events.description: Banxico held its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 7.00%.

facts.fact_text: The Bank of Mexico left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 7.00% in its February 5, 2026 meeting.

evidences.evidence_text: The Bank of Mexico left its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 7.00% in its February 5, 2026 meeting

facts.fact_text: The rate of 7.00% is the lowest level since May 2022.

evidences.evidence_text: keeping the rate at its lowest level since May 2022

facts.fact_text: Mexico’s economic activity expanded in Q4 2025 after the contraction recorded in Q3.

evidences.evidence_text: Mexico’s economic activity expanded in Q4 2025 after the contraction recorded in Q3

facts.fact_text: Headline inflation eased slightly to 3.77% in mid-January from 3.80% in November.

evidences.evidence_text: Headline inflation eased slightly to 3.77% in mid-January from 3.80% in November

facts.fact_text: Core inflation rose to 4.47% (from 4.43%), remaining stubbornly above 4%.

evidences.evidence_text: core inflation rose to 4.47% (from 4.43%), remaining stubbornly above 4%

claims.claim_text: The Board warned that downside risks from trade tensions and global uncertainty persist.
claims.author: the Board

evidences.evidence_text: although the Board warned that downside risks from trade tensions and global uncertainty persist

claims.claim_text: Banxico now projects inflation will converge to its 3% target in the second quarter of 2027.
claims.author: Banxico

evidences.evidence_text: Banxico now projects inflation will converge to its 3% target in the second quarter of 2027.

evidence.evidence_text: The decision to hold was taken unanimously by the Board, which judged a pause appropriate given the current inflation outlook and the need to assess the impact of policy changes.
Mexico’s economic activity expanded in Q4 2025 after the contraction recorded in Q3
downside risks from trade tensions and global uncertainty persist
